qas.question: What discipline can undergraduate students interested in general health study?
Immunology is a branch of what larger field of study?
The goal of an immunologist is to study what beings?
The biggest part of an immunologist's job is what?
What two conditions apply to good immunological study?

context: <a0_0>Bioscience<a0_0/> is the overall major in which undergraduate students who are interested in general well-being take in college. Immunology is a branch of <a1_0>bioscience<a1_0/> for undergraduate programs but the major gets specified as students move on for graduate program in immunology. The aim of immunology is to study the health of <a2_0>humans and animals<a2_0/> through <a4_0>effective yet consistent research<a4_0/>, (AAAAI, 2013). The most important thing about being immunologists is the <a3_0>research<a3_0/> because it is the biggest portion of their jobs.
